summary: Activity identifiers in the TypeScript SDK include the module name using JSON.stringify([module, functionName]), but this is inconsistent with other SDKs. The fix should use only the function name as the identifier and have the Worker throw an error on duplicate activity names.
userImpact: Users experience inconsistent activity naming behavior compared to other Temporal SDKs, and cannot easily refactor activities to different modules.
rootCause: The TypeScript SDK uses JSON.stringify([module, functionName]) instead of just the function name for activity identifiers, creating a cross-SDK inconsistency.
proposedFix: Use only the function name as the activity identifier and have the Worker throw an error if multiple activities are registered with the same name.
resolutionDetails: Changed activity identifier generation to use only the function name instead of including the module, with duplicate name validation in the Worker.
keyQuote: We should be consistent with the other SDKs and use only the function name.
